document_title: What is infertility? Causes, signs, diagnosis, prevention
subsection_content:
To diagnose infertility, depending on each case, the doctor will prescribe different tests to ensure an accurate diagnosis of the disease as well as check the body's response to the treatment regimen. (4)
To diagnose female infertility, there are diagnostic methods such as:
1. Basic tests:
Basic tests to diagnose female infertility include: Immunoassay, AMH test, Chlamydia test, thyroid test (TSH, T3, FT4), endocrine test FSH, LH, E2, Prolactin , P4, cervical and breast cancer screening test.
Necessary ultrasound:
Gynecological ultrasound, ultrasound to count secondary follicles, ultrasound to monitor the development of ovarian follicles, ultrasound of uterine pumping.
Hysterosalpingography (HSG) is used to evaluate the patency of the fallopian tubes.; Hysteroscopy is often used to observe the uterine cavity, helping to diagnose and treat uterine abnormalities. This can be the cause of infertility or repeated implantation failure.
The AMH test helps predict the number of eggs remaining in the ovaries.
To diagnose male infertility, there are diagnostic methods such as:
Basic tests:
Basic tests to diagnose male infertility include: Semen test (semen analysis test), immunological test, endocrine test in men, post-ejaculation urine test, Genetic testing: gene testing and karyotyping, testing to check the level of DNA breakage in sperm (Halosperm Test).
Some necessary ultrasounds include: Testicular ultrasound, abdominal ultrasound...
Semen analysis is the first test to check the quantity and quality of male sperm.
